body:
### Describe the bug

I upgraded from Cython 0.29 to 3.0.2 and I encounter what seems a bug to me, with the C code generated when calling `__Pyx_SetPackagePathFromImportLib` for `__init__` module under a package (I have a specific Cython build where I Cythonize the `__init__.py` under my packages).

After spending some time to understand the problem, it is related to this recent modification : [https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/4764](https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/4764). 

In the following code : 
https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/beaf3f4265f138f17ac28f396ec0f191998d624b/Cython/Compiler/ModuleNode.py#L3338-L3349

It sends `self.full_module_name` to the `__Pyx_SetPackagePathFromImportLib` function. But `__Pyx_SetPackagePathFromImportLib` seems to expect **the module name** instead (and not the fully qualified name of the module)
https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/beaf3f4265f138f17ac28f396ec0f191998d624b/Cython/Utility/ImportExport.c#L443-L454

Using Cython 3.0.2 I get the following error (at execution time) while importing a package (let's say `pack_a` for instance) : 
```python
Exception ignored in: 'pack_a.__init__'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".\importlib\util.py", line 98, in find_spec
ModuleNotFoundError: __path__ attribute not found on 'pack_a' while trying to find 'pack_a.__init__'
```

If now, in `ModuleNode` I replace `self.full_module_name` on line 3347 by `env.module_name`, everything works fine as before.

I tried to describe this issue the best I could. I apologize, I do not have a simple example to illustrate this issue.

Thank you in advance.

 

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
# example code
```


### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

Windows

### Python version

3.9.18

### Cython version

3.0.2

### Additional context

_No response_
title: [BUG] __Pyx_SetPackagePathFromImportLib is called with a wrong argument
